result.reason: The RDP ActiveX control is explicitly set to Anchor=None during initialization, overriding Dock=Fill and preventing the session window from resizing with the application. Removing this line will restore proper docking behavior.
result.approach: Remove 'Control.Anchor = AnchorStyles.None;' in RdpProtocol.cs (in both InitializeActiveXControl and InitializeActiveXControlAsync) to allow the control to respect 'Dock = DockStyle.Fill' set by the base class.

attempts.raw_output:
The issue "RDP window not expandable" is caused by the RDP ActiveX control being explicitly set to `Anchor = AnchorStyles.None` in `RdpProtocol.cs`, which overrides the `Dock = DockStyle.Fill` setting from the base class. This prevents the RDP session window from resizing when the mRemoteNG window is resized (breaking "Smart Sizing" and general layout). `RdpProtocol8` (RDP 8+) implements a manual resize workaround, but the default `RdpProtocol` (RDP < 8) lacks this, leading to the reported behavior.

The fix is to remove the `Control.Anchor = AnchorStyles.None;` line in `RdpProtocol.cs`.

```json
{
  "decision": "implement",
  "reason": "The RDP ActiveX control is explicitly set to Anchor=None during initialization, overriding Dock=Fill and preventing the session window from resizing with the application. Removing this line will restore proper docking behavior.",
  "priority": "P2-bug",
  "estimated_files": [
    "mRemoteNG/Connection/Protocol/RDP/RdpProtocol.cs"
  ],
  "approach": "Remove 'Control.Anchor = AnchorStyles.None;' in RdpProtocol.cs (in both InitializeActiveXControl and InitializeActiveXControlAsync) to allow the control to respect 'Dock = DockStyle.Fill' set by the base class."
}
```
